for_sales.sales_text: Knot a Clew (Knotty for short) is a Mevagissey Tosher 18 which I bought second-hand from Gaffers & Luggers in Mylor Bridge Cornwall in 2011. Having sailed on Falmouth working boats I think of her as a smaller cousin. Recently Knotty has undergone some quite extensive renovations below waterline. Hull stripped down to gelcoat; Keel reinforced with an 8” epoxy GRP wrap around then epoxy coatings/antifoul applied. Internally, the old Cornish concrete was removed, the hull reinforced with polyester resin GRP and chrome steel punchings added. A new plywood floor has been built (similar to Ariel of Greystones – see their website for info). New Plywood bulkheads and a new plywood /hardwood deck in work but needs completion (The level of the deck has been raised with a false bulwark). Unfortunately, a change in circumstances forces her sale but this would be an ideal winter project for someone. She is currently lying on a marina berth in Sovereign Harbour in Eastbourne with a temporary watertight cover. Knotty’s hull is on sale for the princely sum of £1. She can also be bought with a cruising gaff rig with bowsprit and topsail, a 6hp Tohatsu sail drive outboard with very low hours and a selection of hardwood sufficient to complete the new deck. All of these are negotiable on price.
for_sales.summary: sold through another route, but did generate 2 enquiries through the OGA
